explanation: The report is essentially correct. MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 requires pointers to point to const-qualified types whenever the pointee is not modified. In the presented code the incoming parameter is declared as const struct MHD_RqDAuthParam *param, but the underlying string-with-length type exposes a char *str (non-const). In get_unquoted_param_copy the code only reads from param->value.str (memcpy and passing it to a function taking const char *), so the pointee is effectively read-only here. Declaring the member as const char *str in the string-with-length type would reflect the read-only intent and satisfy Rule 8.13. Note that the mutable destination structure (_MHD_mstr_w_len with char *str) must remain non-const because the code writes into that buffer; the violation is in the source/string-with-length declaration, not in the local use inside get_unquoted_param_copy. Also be aware that changing the member to const char * may require propagating const-correctness throughout the codebase where that type is used.
